case_vignette: A fullterm newborn African American male is noticed by nursing staff to have multiple dark spots on the head and neck present at birth! The patient was born via spontaneous vaginal delivery and had an unremarkable prenatal course! Examination reveals scattered collarettes of scale on the face and neck and few ovoid hyperpigmented macules scattered on the neck! Remainder of exam was unremarkable!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have multiple dark spots on my head and neck that were present at birth, and there are also some scattered flaky patches of skin on my face and neck.
Have these spots or patches changed in size, shape, or color recently?
No, they have not changed in size, shape, or color.
Do you have any family members with similar symptoms or any known genetic conditions?
I am not aware of any family members with similar symptoms or known genetic conditions.
Have you experienced any other symptoms such as vision problems, learning difficulties, or growths under the skin?
No, I have not experienced any other symptoms like vision problems, learning difficulties, or growths under the skin.
Do the flaky patches of skin improve with any specific treatments or skin care routines?
I haven't tried any specific treatments or skin care routines to see if they improve the flaky patches of skin.
Final Diagnosis: Nevus Sebaceous

trial_0.summarized_frq: Congenital melanocytic nevi with associated seborrheic dermatitis.
